column5: What is the water level situation in general for northwest ontario? are the lakes low? whats the outlook? Thanks for the help

We were on a river system north of PICKLE LAKE never had been there before and the locals said the water was 5 ft. higher than normal we had to go thru 2 ft. of snow to get down to the water and it melted in the week we were there the rivers coming into this lake were very wild. my .03.5 worth

We just got back from Umfreville Lake which is about 50mi NW of Minaki, 100Mi NW of Kenora. Water levels were probably about normal to down a bit as compared to last year. Definitely not high in this area. This is in the English and Sturgeon river system. Coming through Kenora LOTW looked a bit low.
lac seul was down 2-1/2 to 3 feet from last year. 5/25 -5/31
Unofficial rumor that LOTW is about 30" below normal. Watch out for the rocks!
